description: Test configuration with explicit control point times instead of automatic spacing

scalar_parameters._psi2: Gives same fractional damage as DICE for delta_T=1.941 and y_net = 23239 (2050 values in DICE baseline) assuminng 10k$
scalar_parameters._k_climate: From DICE central case emissions and temperature change 2020 to 2050; Temperature sensitivity to cumulative  (K/tCO2) 0.5e-12 ~ 1.8 K per 1000 GtC [noe we are in CO2 units]
scalar_parameters._rho: Pure rate of time preference (1 % per year)
scalar_parameters._fract_gdp: Fraction of GDP available for redistribution and abatement
scalar_parameters._mu_max: Maximum allowed abatement fraction (cap on μ). Values >1 allow carbon removal.
scalar_parameters._Ecum_initial: Initial cumulative CO2 emissions (tCO2). Set to 0 for no prior emissions. 1.24715/k_climate to match 2020 Barrage & Nordhaus 2023.
scalar_parameters._K_initial: Initial capital stock ($). Represents total productive capital at start of simulation.
scalar_parameters._y_net_reference: Reference net income level ($) for income-dependent damage calculation. Typically set to current global average net income.
scalar_parameters._income_dependent_damage_distribution: If true, damage weighted towards low-income (uses y_damage_distribution_exponent and y_net_reference)
scalar_parameters._income_dependent_aggregate_damage: Subswitch of income_dependent_damage_distribution: If false, aggregate damage is fixed and distribution adjusted to match; if true, aggregate damage decreases as world gets richer
scalar_parameters._income_dependent_tax_policy: If true, progressive tax (tax richest); if false, uniform fractional tax
scalar_parameters._income_redistribution: If true, enable redistribution; if false, no redistribution (all revenues to abatement)
scalar_parameters._income_dependent_redistribution_policy: Subswitch of income_redistribution. If true, targeted to lowest income; if false, uniform dividend
scalar_parameters._t_base: Base year for time functions. Functions receive (t - t_base).

A._initial_value: DICE is 5.84 with capital stock in trillions; pop in millions
A._final_value: DICE is 38743.985 with capital stock in trillions; pop in millions
A._adjustment_coefficient: analytic representation of Barrage and Nordhaus 2023 TFP projection

L._adjustment_coefficient: analytic representation of Barrage and Nordhaus 2023 population projection

sigma._initial_value: tons CO2 per $, from kg per $ in Barage & Nordhaus 2023
sigma._final_value: tons CO2 per $, from kgCO2 per $ in Barage & Nordhaus 2023
sigma._adjustment_coefficient: analytic representation of Barrage and Nordhaus 2023 carbon intensity projection

theta1._description: Abatement cost per ton of CO2 for the last ton abated ($/tCO2)
theta1._initial_value: Best 2 double exponential fit to Barage & Nordhaus 2023
theta1._growth_rate_1: 2-exponential fit to sigma in Barrage & Nordhaus 2023
theta1._growth_rate_2: 2-exponential fit to sigma in Barrage & Nordhaus 2023
theta1._fract_1: 2-exponential fit to sigma in Barrage & Nordhaus 2023

gini._description: Background Gini index (restoring attractor for Gini dynamics), assuming t = 0 is year 2020
gini._exponential_scaling: Exponential scaling to represent projected Gini changes over time from SSP2, https://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/1748-9326/acbdb0
gini._additive_constant: Additive constant to represent projected Gini changes over time from SSP2, https://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/1748-9326/acbdb0
gini._growth_rate: Growth rate to represent projected Gini changes over time from SSP2, https://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/1748-9326/acbdb0

integration_parameters._plot_short_horizon: Time horizon (years) for short-term detailed plots. Creates second PDF book with results from t_start to this time.
integration_parameters._n_quad: Number of quadrature points for integral calculations (e.g., utility integrals).

optimization_parameters._description: EXPLICIT CONTROL POINT TIMES - uses user-specified time points instead of automatic geometric spacing
optimization_parameters._max_evaluations_initial: Maximum number of objective function evaluations
optimization_parameters._max_evaluations_final: Maximum number of objective function evaluations
optimization_parameters._max_evaluations_time_points: Maximum number of objective function evaluations for time point adjustment optimization
optimization_parameters._optimization_iterations: Must be 1 when using explicit control point times
optimization_parameters._n_points_final_f: Explicit control point times in calendar years for f (abatement fraction)
optimization_parameters._initial_guess_f: Initial f value for all control points
optimization_parameters._bounds_f: Bounds for f (abatement fraction) as [min, max]
optimization_parameters._initial_guess_s: Initial s value for all control points. Presence enables dual optimization.
optimization_parameters._bounds_s: Bounds for s (savings rate) as [min, max]
optimization_parameters._n_points_final_s: Explicit control point times in calendar years for s (savings rate)
